  "Allegations" : "COMPLAINANT ALLEGES THAT HIS AGENT ADVISED HIM THAT THERE WOULD BE NO COST TO THE PLAN PARTICPANTS OF HIS 401K PLAN IF THE PLAN WAS TRANSFERRED FROM OPPENHEIMER FUNDS TO AMERICAN FUNDS. COMPLAINANT ALLEGES THAT AS A RESULT OF THIS TRANSFER THE [CUSTOMER] 401K PLAN WAS ASSESSED A 2% REDEMPTION FEE TOTALING $17,036.66.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$17,036.66",

  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",

  "Broker Comment" : "THE BROKER WAS ADVISED BY THE CLIENT'S FUND COMPANY RETIREMENT PLAN REPRESENTATIVE THAT THERE WOULD BE NO COST TO THE PLAN PARTICIPANTS OF A 401K PLAN IF THE PLAN WAS TRANSFERRED TO ANOTHER FUND COMPANY.  WHEN THE PLAN WAS TRANSFERRED THERE WAS A MARKET VALUE ADJUSTMENT AND THE BROKER PHONED THE FUND COMPANY TO DISPUTE THE CHARGES.  THE FUND COMPANY REFUSED TO PARTICIPATE IN PROPER SETTLEMENT TO THE CLIENT SO THE BROKER BROUGHT IT TO THE CLIENT'S ATTENTION AND SETTLED TO AVOID LOSSES TO THE CLIENT'S 401K PLAN TO MAINTAIN THEIR RELATIONSHIP AND AVOID TIME SPENT IN LITIGATION WITH FUND COMPANY.  THIS SETTLEMENT WAS RESOLVED QUICKLY TO AVOID ANY LOSSES TO THE CLIENT, INCLUDING INTEREST EARNED DURING SETTLEMENT.  THE BROKER HAS MAINTAINED A GOOD WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH THE CLIENT."
}
